intro: Rhexia canescens, commonly known as the frostweed, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, silver-green foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, showy pink or red flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Rhexia canescens is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
